markdownRemark.html: A similar set of arguments was rehearsed a year later (1560) by the Salamanca printer/publisher Juan Bautista de Terranova in his edition of Terence. His preface (fols. a2r-v) is notable for stressing the importance of reading pleasure as a stimulus towards mastering Latin through the study of Terence and other enjoyable classical authors.
